intro: Pavia rubra var. arguta, commonly known as the roughleaf pavia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its rough, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is found in parts of eastern North America. It produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
